Comment: I’m an American living abroad. My kids like McDonald’s and so we occasionally indulge them. As I’m traveling around Europe, on my travel days specifically when I haven’t the spoons to explore, I’ll sometimes grab McDonald’s on my way to crashing at my hotel just to see what each country has at their McDonald’s.  Food quality at European McDonald’s is actually much better than in the US, generally. I mean don’t get me wrong, it’s still not great food and quite unhealthy, but it’s not quite as _egregious_ elsewhere.  In my town in the Netherlands, the local McDonald’s is a popular Friday night treat for a lot of families with younger kids, maybe once or twice a month, and it’s a very popular hangout spot with teenagers over the weekend.  But you can definitely see a big drop off in crowd sizes in the last couple of months. The teenagers are generally still around in similar numbers, but the young families aren’t there anywhere near as much.
Author: deVliegendeTexan
